subject: Communication
title: Head Tilts, Nods, and Shakes
description: A short lesson to help you apply Head Tilts, Nods, and Shakes.

hook.text: A slow head nod means 'I'm listening.' A fast nod means 'hurry up.' Same gesture, different speed, different meaning.

buildup.text: Head nods regulate conversation â€” they signal agreement, encouragement, and turn-taking without words.

discovery.text: Head tilting exposes the neck â€” a vulnerable area. It signals interest, curiosity, or submission.

twist.text: In Bulgaria and parts of Greece, nodding means 'no' and shaking means 'yes.' The gesture isn't universal.

climax.text: Even small head movements matter: a slight chin raise signals confidence; a chin tuck signals submission.

punchline.text: The head nod is the simplest gesture. It's not the simplest signal.
